hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) and BTC experiences a 5-day Bollinger Band width contraction below 0.15, the subsequent breakout above the 20-day SMA with >5% daily volume increase will signal a transition to BULL regime with 70% probability, generating a mean 8% return over 7 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes represent equilibrium between buyers/sellers. Compression indicates building energy. Breakout with volume confirms institutional participation. The 20-day SMA acts as dynamic support/resistance. Confirmation across BTC/ETH reduces false signals.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes >20-day SMA with >5% volume spike vs 20-day average
ETH confirms with price >20-day SMA and positive BTC-ETH correlation >0.7

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% gain from entry or regime transitions to BULL (confidence >70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% below entry price or regime transitions to BEAR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals result in immediate reversal (regime returns to NEUTRAL within 3 days) or fail to achieve 5% gains within 7 days.
